name: indispensably

to such a degree that it is too important not to do or have: indispensably necessary For this job, a good night's sleep is indispensably necessary. Talking to the families of your patients is indispensably important.
More examplesFewer examplesThis new scheme may well become indispensably attractive to foreign tourists in this area.A regular supply of grain was indispensably necessary for feeding the army.We must focus on producing the commodities that are indispensably necessary for our survival.
